Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bosnian general election and the 2022 Republika Srpska general election were held on October 2, 2022 (5). The Republika Srpska entity, which has a predominantly Serb population, is highly independent (5). Opposition parties have accused Milorad Dodik of election fraud (8). Dodik has also sought secession for Republika Srpska (9). International election observers have held a press conference to present their findings (10).

Timeline.Text: Voters head to the polls in Bosnia and Herzegovina for the general election, with growing ethnic tensions dominating the campaign.
Opposition parties in Republika Srpska file criminal complaints against Milorad Dodik and 180 others for election fraud.
Milorad Dodik travels to Moscow to meet with Putin ahead of the election.
A recount confirms that pro-Russia Serb leader Milorad Dodik has won the general election.
The results of the general election are officially announced, with the election of the three-member Bosnian Presidency and the Abgeordnetenhaus.
Voting day for the general election in Kenya, with a tight race between Raila Odinga and William Ruto.
US names Kenya as a major ally, as the Kenya general election continues.
The international election observation mission holds a press conference to present their findings on the general election in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bosnian general election resulted in a win for moderate Bosniak candidate Denis Becirevic (1,7). The 2022 Italian general election resulted in a majority of seats for the center-right coalition (2). The 2022 Kenyan presidential election saw William Ruto confirmed as the country's fifth president (3,5,6). The 2022 Illinois Attorney General election resulted in a win for Democrat Kwame Raoul (9).

Timeline.Text: Kenya goes to the polls for its third general election since the promulgation of a new constitution in 2010.
William Ruto is announced as the winner of the Kenyan presidential election, receiving 7,176,141 votes.
The Kenyan Supreme Court confirms William Ruto as the country's fifth president, rejecting Raila Odinga's petition challenging the election results.
Moderate Bosniak candidate Denis Becirevic leads in the race for a seat on Bosnia's tripartite inter-ethnic presidency.
A recount of ballots cast for the Bosnian Serb presidency begins in Sarajevo.
Kwame Raoul wins the attorney general race in Illinois and post-election ballot tallies narrow the gap in Arizona's gubernatorial race.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bosnian general election (1,2,3,4,6,7,9) took place on October 2 and resulted in a new tripartite presidency (3) and members of the House of Representatives and assemblies (4). There were concerns about potential fraud (7) and support from Hungary for the Bosnian Serbs (8). Changes to the election law were imposed by the international peace overseer (6). Pre-election tensions between Bosniaks and Croats have resurfaced (10).

Timeline.Text: The general election begins in Bosnia and Herzegovina, with over 5,900 polling stations opening.
The Central Election Commission confirms the preliminary results of the general election, with the Bosniak and Croatian presidency candidates taking the lead.
Thousands protest alleged election fraud in the Bosnian town of Banja Luka, leading to a recount of the Bosnian Serb presidency race.
The international peace overseer imposes changes to the election law to prevent blockades of the regional government.
The elected politicians of the new tripartite presidency take office and vow to resolve mounting issues in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Amid a pre-election standoff between Bosniaks and Croats, rhetoric from the 1990s war reappears. The internationally appointed high representative may need to make reforms to settle the quarrel.
Wahlen in Bosnien und Herzegowina 2022 take place, resulting in the election of the tripartite presidency and the House of Representatives.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bosnian general election was a highly contested and closely watched event (1,2,3,5,6,9,10,12,13,17). It was held on October 2 and resulted in the election of Milorad Dodik as the new leader of the Republika Srpska entity (1). However, allegations of election fraud have been made by opposition parties (13). The election was also monitored by international observers (17). The election was seen as a pivotal moment for the country, which is still recovering from the Bosnian War and is divided into two governing entities (10,12).
